Package eu.kartoffelquadrat.asyncrestlib

Class ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest

java.lang.Object
eu.kartoffelquadrat.asyncrestlib.ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest
public class ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest
extends java.lang.Object
Test the ARLs timeout behavior (return code) and burst messages.
Author:
Maximilian Schiedermeier on 2019/09/02 maximilian.schiedermeier@mail.mcgill.ca

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void prepareTest()  
    void testDeferredResultCompletionOnBcmModification()  
    void testHashedTransformerlessUpdates()
    A client who does not provide a hash mast be notified about all status updates.
    void testMissingImmediateResultWithoutHash()
    If we do not provide a hash, the library must defer the result until a content update has occurred on server side (or a timeout happened).
    void testNullHashedUpdate()
    Similar to previous test but provoques a nullpointer by transferring a null object as hash for the update request.
    void testTimeoutReturnCode()
    Create a new ResponseGenerator with 50ms timeout, trigger timeout and check the return code in the HTTP header is correct.
    void verifyTerminated()
    Verify that a terminated BCM always leads to a 410 (gone) HTTP Code.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest

      public ContentUpdateResponseGeneratorTest()

  • Method Details

    • prepareTest

      public void prepareTest()

    • testMissingImmediateResultWithoutHash

      public void testMissingImmediateResultWithoutHash()
      If we do not provide a hash, the library must defer the result until a content update has occurred on server side (or a timeout happened). If we directly check for a result, it should not yet be set.

    • testDeferredResultCompletionOnBcmModification

      public void testDeferredResultCompletionOnBcmModification()

    • testTimeoutReturnCode

      public void testTimeoutReturnCode() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Create a new ResponseGenerator with 50ms timeout, trigger timeout and check the return code in the HTTP header is correct. Note that the timeout can ONLY OCCUR if the hash of the default value is provided.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException

    • testHashedTransformerlessUpdates

      public void testHashedTransformerlessUpdates()
      A client who does not provide a hash mast be notified about all status updates.

    • testNullHashedUpdate

      public void testNullHashedUpdate()
      Similar to previous test but provoques a nullpointer by transferring a null object as hash for the update request.

    • verifyTerminated

      public void verifyTerminated() throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Verify that a terminated BCM always leads to a 410 (gone) HTTP Code.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
